body.name: HiLIFE Steamer for Clothes, Portable Clothes Steamer with 240ml Big Capacity, Strong Penetrating Handheld Garment Steam iron for Clothes, Removes Wrinkle, for Home, Office and Travel(Only for 120v)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 11 hrs 38 mins
FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 21 hrs 8 mins
features: Easy Operation: Hilife steamer for clothes has a 9 ft power cord and it produces long-lasting, gentle steam so that you do not have to worry about operating it remotely and ironing your clothes from a distance.

Wrinkle-Free In Minutes: Eliminate wrinkles on your clothes and fabrics easily. Hilife Clothes steamers are an efficient and reliable way to remove wrinkles from apparel, furniture covers, and curtains.
Large Tank Capacity: Hilife 700W steam iron for clothes has a water holding capacity of 240 ml, which can provide up to 15 minutes of continuous steaming to eliminate wrinkles
Strong Penetration Steam: Hilife handheld steamer has a strong penetrating steam that can be used over a wide range of fabrics like chiffon, silk, wool, cotton, linen, nylon, and many more.

Power Requirement: Hilife Garment Steamer is best for countries like the US, Canada, and Japan where the voltage is 110 to 120 volts. However, Plugging into a 220V to 240V or not 110 to 120V outlet will damage the product

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good for the money paid
reviews.reviewText: This is the first time I try steam iron thing. It is okey, not the super super quality(plastic afterall) but does the the job perfectly. I would recommend as it is very affordable and still works perfectly after many hours of working.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use and it’s great at getting out wrinkles

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Quick and Easy!
reviews.reviewText: This is perfect to use in the mornings before work or steaming the night before! It heats up fast and it is light weight, honestly anyone could use it! My only complaint is that sometimes it leaks water if you are setting it directly on to the clothing item that you are steaming and it takes a minute to dry but other than that its perfect!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little steamer
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a good portable steamer for getting creases out of a green screened and this was perfect. Did a great job, quick and easy to use. I love that there is no trigger to hold. Creates steady steam for 10-15 minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Handy, portable and easy to use for quick wrinkles and unpacking luggage with less ironing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not super impressed
reviews.reviewText: I am not overly impressed with this. There is no pausing the steam, it just keeps going unless you turn it off and back on to reheat and then you have to wait. Also spurted water not just steam which on some of my tops requires the blow dryer to come out to dry the fabric from having a spot all day. Not the most powerful thing so definitely takes some time and working to unwrinkle. It’s a nice price, but not what I had hoped to get out of it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This really works well on my sweaters, and most anything that needs a touch up. Heats quickly; highly recommend this steamer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This is awesome!
reviews.reviewText: So I have two other handheld garment steamers and I hate them. I ordered this one half expecting to not like it either, but I was very pleasantly surprised. I steamed two 4x8 blackout curtain panels and two valances in about 20 mins. The steamer held enough water to run for close to 12 minutes, which did 1 curtain and 1 valance. The initial heat time was 1 min 45 sec, when already hot each refill took about 1 min 15 sec to heat.After I knocked out the curtains, I steamed 2 of my husband's long sleeved shirts, 6 child t-shirts (some not pictured) and a pair of child's pants in roughly 10 mins, and 1 tank of water. The shirts and pants had spent about 24 hours in the dryer and were very very wrinkled. This is hands down the best steamer I have tried.Cons:When the water level gets to about 1/4 inch, it violently bubbles and will spew large globs of hot water. Avoidable by keeping an eye on the water level, but inconvenient and a burn hazard.You cannot tilt it forward very far, depending on water level, or it will spill out the nozzle.
